parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
A comment ID to seek to. Comments up to and including the specified
     *                          ID are excluded from the results and do not count towards `max`.
     *                          Useful for pagination. Commonly set to the `lastSeen` property from
     *                          a previous query.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description:
Maximum number of comments to return. This does not guarantee that
     *                          `max` comments are returned. It does guarantee that the number of
     *                          comments returned won't exceed `max`.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description:
Only comments for given topic are returned.
     *                          Examples: `reviews/1234`, `changes/1234` or `jobs/job001234`.

parameters.name: context[version]
parameters.description:
If a `reviews/1234` topic is provided, limit returned comments to a specific version of
     *                          the provided review.

parameters.name: ignoreArchived
parameters.description: Prevents archived comments from being returned. (v5+)

parameters.name: tasksOnly
parameters.description: Returns only comments that have been flagged as tasks. (v5+)

parameters.name: taskStates
parameters.description:
Limit the returned comments to ones that match the provided task state (one or more of
     *                          `open`, `closed`, `verified`, or `comment`). (v5+)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
An optional comma-separated list (or array) of fields to show for each comment.
     *                          Omitting this parameter or passing an empty value shows all fields.

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description:
Topic to comment on.
     *                          Examples: `reviews/1234`, `changes/1234` or `jobs/job001234`.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Content of the comment.

parameters.name: taskState
parameters.description:
Optional task state of the comment. Valid values when adding a comment are `comment`
     *                          and `open`. This creates a plain comment or opens a task, respectively.

parameters.name: flags[]
parameters.description: Optional flags on the comment. Typically set to `closed` to archive a comment.

parameters.name: context[file]
parameters.description:
File to comment on. Valid only for `changes` and `reviews` topics.
     *                          Example: `//depot/main/README.txt`.

parameters.name: context[leftLine]
parameters.description:
Left-side diff line to attach the inline comment to.  Valid only for `changes` and
     *                          `reviews` topics. If this is specified, `context[file]` must also be specified.

parameters.name: context[rightLine]
parameters.description:
Right-side diff line to attach the inline comment to.  Valid only for `changes` and
     *                          `reviews` topics. If this is specified, `context[file]` must also be specified.

parameters.name: context[content]
parameters.description:
Optionally provide content of the specified line and its four preceding lines. This
     *                          is used to specify a short excerpt of context in case the lines being commented
     *                          on change during the review.
     *
     *                          When not provided, Swarm makes an effort to build the content on its own - as this
     *                          involves file operations, it could become slow.

parameters.name: context[version]
parameters.description: With a `reviews` topic, this field specifies which version to attach the comment to.

operations.notes: Add a comment to a topic (such as a review or a job)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the comment to be edited

parameters.name: topic
parameters.description:
Topic to comment on.
     *                          Examples: `reviews/1234`, `changes/1234` or `jobs/job001234`.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Content of the comment.

parameters.name: taskState
parameters.description:
Optional task state of the comment. Note that certain transitions (such as moving from
     *                          `open` to `verified`) are not possible without an intermediate step (`addressed`, in
     *                          this case).
     *                          Examples: `comment` (not a task), `open`, `addressed`, `verified`.

parameters.name: flags[]
parameters.description: Optional flags on the comment. Typically set to `closed` to archive a comment.
